item.title: Microsoft investigates Microsoft 365 outage affecting users, admins
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating an ongoing outage preventing users and admins from accessing some Microsoft 365 services and the admin center. [...]

item.title: FBI seizes domains for Cracked.io, Nulled.to hacking forums
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI has seized the domains for the infamous Cracked.io and Nulled.to hacking forums, which are known for their focus on cybercrime, password theft, cracking, and credential stuffing attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 11's Start menu is getting iPhone and Android integration
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Windows 11's Start menu is getting a big update with full-fledged Android and iPhone integration, allowing users improved access to users' mobile texts and images from their computers. [...]

item.title: Uncover Hidden Browsing Threats: Get a Free Risk Assessment for GenAI, Identity, Web, and SaaS Risks
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by LayerX
item.description: As GenAI tools and SaaS platforms become a staple component in the employee toolkit, the risks associated with data exposure, identity vulnerabilities, and unmonitored browsing behavior have skyrocketed. Learn how a complimentary LayerX risk assessment can help identify, assess, and address browsing and SaaS risks in your workplace. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit critical unpatched flaw in Zyxel CPE devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are exploiting a critical command injection vulnerability in Zyxel CPE Series devices that is currently tracked as CVE-2024-40891 and remains unpatched since last July. [...]

item.title: January Windows 10 preview update force installs new Outlook
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has started force-installing the new Outlook email client on Windows 10 systems for users who deploy this month's KB5050081 non-security preview update. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5050094 update fixes bugs causing audio issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has released the optional KB5050094 Preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with 28 bug fixes and changes, including fixes for bugs causing audio playback issues on systems with USB audio device drivers. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploiting flaws in SimpleHelp RMM to breach networks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are believed to be exploiting recently fixed SimpleHelp Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) software vulnerabilities to gain initial access to target networks. [...]

item.title: Google to kill Chrome Sync on older Chrome browser versions
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google announced that the Chrome Sync feature will be discontinued in early 2025 for Chrome versions older than four years. [...]

item.title: Garmin GPS watches crashing, stuck in triangle 'reboot loop'
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Garmin users are reporting that their watches crash when using apps that require GPS access and then get stuck in a reboot loop, showing a blue triangle logo. [...]

item.title: New Apple CPU side-channel attacks steal data from browsers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A team of security researchers has disclosed new side-channel vulnerabilities in modern Apple processors that could steal sensitive information from web browsers. [...]

item.title: Engineering giant Smiths Group discloses security breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: London-based engineering giant Smiths Group disclosed a security breach after unknown attackers gained access to the company's systems. [...]

item.title: Signal will let you sync old messages when linking new devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Signal is finally adding a new feature that allows users to synchronize their old message history from their primary iOS or Android devices to newly linked devices like desktops and iPads. [...]
